intro: Trigonostemon hookerianus, commonly known as the Hooker's trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive tri-lobed leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a typical feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Trigonostemon hookerianus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
